```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```

```{r}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")
```

```{r}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS,
          color = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()
```

### CSS Highlight

When the mouse is placed on a certain point, it will highlight the point using a specific color.

```{r}
library(ggiraph)

p <- ggplot(data = exam_data, 
            aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive(
    aes(
      tooltip = ID,
      data_id = ID 
    ),
    stackgroups = TRUE, 
    binwidth = 1, 
    method = "histodot"
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)

girafe(
  ggobj = p,
  width_svg = 6,
  height_svg = 6 * 0.618,
  options = list(
    opts_hover(css = "fill:skyblue;r:2pt;")
  )
)
```

:::
